name: Bridge Pose
instructions: Step:1 Lie on your back with knees bent and feet flat on the floor, hip-width apart.
Step:2 Place your arms alongside your body with palms facing down.
Step:3 Press your feet and arms into the floor as you lift your hips toward the ceiling.
Step:4 Keep your thighs and feet parallel, engaging your glutes and core.
Step:5 Hold for 30 seconds to 1 minute, breathing deeply.
Step:6 Slowly lower your hips back down to the floor.
periodBenefits: Helps relieve lower back tension and menstrual cramps while gently strengthening your core
motivationalMessage: This gentle pose is perfect for easing discomfort while keeping your body active! You're doing great! ðŸŒ¸

genderBenefits.male: Strengthens glutes and lower back for better posture and athletic performance
genderBenefits.female: Excellent for pelvic floor strength and relieving lower back tension, especially during menstrual days

ageRecommendations.under18: Great for building core foundation and improving flexibility
ageRecommendations.18-50: Perfect for strengthening glutes and relieving stress from sitting
ageRecommendations.over50: Gentle way to maintain spine mobility and strengthen supporting muscles

name: Cat-Cow Stretch
instructions: Step:1 Start on your hands and knees in a tabletop position.
Step:2 Inhale and arch your back, lifting your chest and tailbone (Cow Pose).
Step:3 Exhale and round your spine, tucking your chin to chest (Cat Pose).
Step:4 Flow between these positions for 5-10 breaths.
Step:5 Move slowly and mindfully with your breath.
periodBenefits: Gentle spinal movement improves circulation and reduces menstrual cramps
motivationalMessage: This flowing movement is like a gentle massage for your spine. Perfect for today! ðŸ’•

genderBenefits.male: Improves spine flexibility and relieves tension from desk work
genderBenefits.female: Excellent for pelvic circulation and relieving menstrual discomfort

ageRecommendations.under18: Builds body awareness and improves posture
ageRecommendations.18-50: Relieves stress and improves spine mobility
ageRecommendations.over50: Gentle way to maintain spine health and reduce stiffness

name: Plank Pose
instructions: Step:1 Start in a push-up position with hands directly under shoulders.
Step:2 Engage your core and keep your body in a straight line from head to heels.
Step:3 Don't let your hips sag or pike up.
Step:4 Hold for 20-60 seconds, breathing steadily.
Step:5 Lower down gently when done.

genderBenefits.male: Builds core strength for better athletic performance and posture
genderBenefits.female: Strengthens core and improves posture, great for overall body stability

ageRecommendations.under18: Perfect for building core foundation and body control
ageRecommendations.18-50: Essential for core strength and functional fitness
ageRecommendations.over50: Try modified plank on knees to build strength safely

name: Dumbbell Front Raise
instructions: Step:1 Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding a dumbbell in each hand with your palms facing your thighs.
Step:2 Keeping your arms straight, exhale and lift the dumbbells in front of you until they are at shoulder level.
Step:3 Pause for a moment at the top, then inhale and slowly lower the dumbbells back down to the starting position.
Step:4 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

genderBenefits.male: Builds strong, defined shoulders for upper body strength
genderBenefits.female: Tones shoulders and improves posture, great for everyday activities

ageRecommendations.under18: Start with lighter weights to build proper form
ageRecommendations.18-50: Great for building shoulder strength and definition
ageRecommendations.over50: Use lighter weights and focus on controlled movement

name: Dips
instructions: Step:1 Position yourself between two parallel bars with your arms fully extended and your body suspended in the air.
Step:2 Bend your knees and cross your ankles.
Step:3 Lower your body by bending your elbows until your upper arms are parallel to the ground.
Step:4 Pause for a moment, then push yourself back up to the starting position by straightening your arms.
Step:5 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

genderBenefits.male: Builds powerful triceps and chest for upper body strength
genderBenefits.female: Strengthens arms and improves upper body tone

ageRecommendations.under18: Try assisted dips or bench dips to build strength first
ageRecommendations.18-50: Excellent for building upper body pushing strength
ageRecommendations.over50: Consider assisted dips or modified versions to protect joints

name: Leg Press
instructions: Step:1 Adjust the seat of the sled machine so that your knees are at a 90-degree angle when your feet are on the footplate.
Step:2 Sit on the sled machine with your back flat against the backrest and your feet shoulder-width apart on the footplate.
Step:3 Grip the handles on the sides of the seat for stability.
Step:4 Push against the footplate to extend your legs, straightening them completely.
Step:5 Pause for a moment at the top, then slowly bend your knees to lower the footplate back to the starting position.
Step:6 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

genderBenefits.male: Builds powerful legs for athletic performance and strength
genderBenefits.female: Tones and strengthens glutes and legs, great for lower body definition

ageRecommendations.under18: Start with lighter weight to build proper form and strength
ageRecommendations.18-50: Perfect for building leg strength and muscle
ageRecommendations.over50: Excellent low-impact option for maintaining leg strength safely

name: Warrior One Pose
instructions: Step:1 Step your left foot back about 3-4 feet, turning it slightly outward.
Step:2 Bend your right knee to 90 degrees, keeping it over your ankle.
Step:3 Square your hips forward and reach your arms overhead.
Step:4 Keep your back leg straight and strong.
Step:5 Hold for 30 seconds to 1 minute, then switch sides.
periodBenefits: Gentle leg strengthening that improves circulation without high impact
motivationalMessage: You're a warrior! This pose builds strength while honoring your body's needs today ðŸ’ªðŸŒ¸

genderBenefits.male: Builds leg strength and improves balance and focus
genderBenefits.female: Strengthens legs and opens hips, great for flexibility and balance

ageRecommendations.under18: Builds leg strength and improves balance and confidence
ageRecommendations.18-50: Great for building lower body strength and mental focus
ageRecommendations.over50: Improves balance and leg strength with modifications as needed

name: Lat Pulldown
instructions: Step:1 Adjust the seat height and position yourself on the machine with your knees under the pads and your feet flat on the ground.
Step:2 Grasp the handles with an overhand grip, slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
Step:3 Sit upright with your chest lifted and your shoulders back, maintaining a slight arch in your lower back.
Step:4 Engage your lats and pull the handles down towards your chest, squeezing your shoulder blades together.
Step:5 Pause for a moment at the bottom of the movement, then slowly release the handles back to the starting position.
Step:6 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

genderBenefits.male: Builds a strong, wide back for upper body power
genderBenefits.female: Tones back and improves posture, great for everyday strength

ageRecommendations.under18: Start with lighter weight to build proper pulling strength
ageRecommendations.18-50: Excellent for building back strength and improving posture
ageRecommendations.over50: Great controlled movement for maintaining back strength safely

name: Sphinx Pose
instructions: Step:1 Lie on your stomach with legs extended behind you.
Step:2 Place your forearms on the floor with elbows under shoulders.
Step:3 Press your forearms down and lift your chest, creating a gentle backbend.
Step:4 Keep your shoulders relaxed away from your ears.
Step:5 Hold for 1-3 minutes, breathing deeply.
periodBenefits: Gentle backbend that relieves lower back tension and opens the chest
motivationalMessage: This calming pose is like a gentle hug for your spine. Perfect for self-care today! ðŸŒ¸

genderBenefits.male: Opens chest and improves spine flexibility
genderBenefits.female: Relieves lower back tension and opens the heart space, great for stress relief

ageRecommendations.under18: Builds spine awareness and improves posture
ageRecommendations.18-50: Counteracts sitting and relieves back tension
ageRecommendations.over50: Gentle way to maintain spine mobility and reduce stiffness

name: Barbell Incline Bench Press
instructions: Step:1 Set up an incline bench at a 45-degree angle.
Step:2 Lie down on the bench with your feet flat on the ground.
Step:3 Grasp the barbell with an overhand grip, slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
Step:4 Unrack the barbell and lower it slowly towards your chest, keeping your elbows at a 45-degree angle.
Step:5 Pause for a moment at the bottom, then push the barbell back up to the starting position.
Step:6 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

genderBenefits.male: Builds powerful upper chest for strength and definition
genderBenefits.female: Tones upper chest and improves upper body strength

ageRecommendations.under18: Start with lighter weight and focus on proper form
ageRecommendations.18-50: Excellent for building upper chest strength and muscle
ageRecommendations.over50: Use lighter weight and consider machine press for joint safety
